r[false] optional env variables to add to the matrix
r[false] semver range for notable versions, that should be pulled from "preset" into "required"
r[false] semver range for optional versions
r[false] optional preset, takes precedence over requireds/optionals
r[false] semver range for required versions
r[false] majors, or minors?
r[false] def[node-version] key in JSON output to contain versions
r[false] ignore the version_key, and make the versions be the root of the outputs?
r[false] JSON object containing allowed-to-fail versions
r[false] JSON object containing required-to-pass versions
r[false] command to run after `npm install`
r[false] command to run after everything succeeds. default runs codecov
r[false] command to run before `npm install`
r[false] if provided, cache node_modules under this cache key
r[false] `npm run` command
r[false] def[lts/*] version of node to use via nvm
r[false] shell command, mutually exclusive with `command`
r[false] def[false] skip `npm install` step
r[false] def[false] skip the `npm ls` check (not recommended)
r[false] def[false] if true, will use `npm ci` instead of `npm install`
r[true] def[${{ github.token }}] The GitHub token (if not provided, the env var GITHUB_TOKEN will be used)
r[true] The pull request number
r[false] Whether the "allow edits" box is checked or not
r[false] def[~/setup-pnpm] Where to store pnpm files
r[false] def[package.json] File path to the package.json to read "packageManager" configuration
r[false] def[null] If specified, run `pnpm install`
r[false] def[false] When set to true, @pnpm/exe, which is a Node.js bundled package, will be installed, enabling using pnpm without Node.js.
r[false] Version of pnpm to install
